greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A008475(n) + 1.
comment: If n = Product (p_i^k_i) for i = 1, …, j then a(n) is sum of divisor d from set of divisors{1, p_1^k_1, p_2^k_2, …, p_j^k_j}.
formula: a(1) = 1, a(p) = p+1, a(pq) = p+q+1, a(pq...z) = p+q+...+z+1, a(p^k) = p^k+1, for p, q = primes, k = natural numbers, pq...z = product of k (k > 2) distinct primes p, q, ..., z.
mathematica: f[n_] := 1 + Plus @@ Power @@@ FactorInteger@ n; f[1] = 1; Array[f, 60]
program: (PARI) a(n)=local(t); if(n<1, 0, t=factor(n); 1+sum(k=1, matsize(t)[1], t[k, 1]^t[k, 2])) /* _Anton Mosunov_, Jan 05 2017 */
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Apr 04 2009
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2009
